abstracts.cdata!:
The First Multistate Water Supply
            Project for Nigeria aims to support economic growth by
            enhancing health and productivity of urban areas, helping to
            alleviate poverty by improving health standards of the
            lowest income urban households and the living conditions of
            women. Negative measures include: water pollution, dust, air
            pollution, noise pollution, waste management, soil erosion,
            and pest management. Mitigation measures include: a) minimum
            tillage technique should be adopted in the catchment area as
            against deep ploughing. The use of animal drawn ploughs
            noticed during the time of visit is a step in the right
            direction; b) use of insect hormones, hormone analogue or
            other chemicals that can mimic the action of insect hormones
            to alter hormone-regulated processes like moulting,
            metamorphosis, reproduction etc; c) biological control of
            pests is the use of pest parasites and predators to wipe out
            unwanted species or populations of pests; d) where
            water-borne sanitation becomes inevitable because of rapid
            urbanization as is expected here, the framework for the
            treatment of sewage should be laid down; and e) water
            pollution control legislation should be reviewed and
            institutional arrangements for enforcement should be established.
